intro: Tetrameles grahamiana var. ceylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon tetrameles, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Sri Lanka, characterized by its rough, fissured bark and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
